intro: Cyrtandra macrobracteata, commonly known as the large bract cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue. The plant produces large, fleshy bracts that enclose the flowers, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest habitats. Cyrtandra macrobracteata is an important species in Hawaiian flora, showcasing unique adaptations to its island ecosystem.
